page.title: 01Farm Land North East Wrelton
page.content: An area of good farmland rising from the vale of Pickering. A sloping dissected plateau from north to south. Majority fields under cultivaton. Sheep on grass and store cattle. Milk herd at Wrelton. 10 disused small quarries and one large quary still in use. 10 farms. The narrow dales planted B/L trees. The woodlands in north east belong to the Queen (Duchy of Lancaster) mainly B/L worked for timber. No sign of manaement in other privately owned blocks. Caravan park at Wrelton. Area popular for visitors. On road to Rosedale and north Yorks Moors. The A170 Helmsley to Scarborough just clips S W corner. Many long narrow fields from Mediaeval times. Roman camps at Cawthorne village in north of block.
